sentences.en: a campaign to discourage smoking among teenagers
sentences.cn: 劝阻青少年吸烟的运动

sentences.en: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.cn: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

sentences.en: Cities will have a powerful incentive to discourage recycling.
sentences.cn: 城市将采取有力的措施阻止再循环.

sentences.en: Don't let one failure discourage you, try again.
sentences.cn: 不要因为一次失败就气馁, 再试一试看.

sentences.en: Don't let one failure discourage you.
He explained the yellow fever epidemic as a providential act to discourage urban growth.
sentences.cn: 他解释说黄热病的流行恰好减缓了城市的扩张。

sentences.en: He used it to discourage any undue sense of danger.
sentences.cn: 他这样做是为了制止任何不适当的危机感.

sentences.en: His parents tried to discourage his interest in music, but he persisted.
sentences.cn: 他的父母设法打消他对音乐的兴趣，但他始终坚持。

sentences.en: I have tried to discourage him from biting nails.
sentences.cn: 我曾劝阻他不要咬指甲.

sentences.en: It may be difficult to do at first. Don't let this discourage you.
sentences.cn: 万事开头难，别因此而灰心。

sentences.en: It's an infernal mischance; I've done my best to discourage it.
sentences.cn: 这真是倒楣透顶的事; 我尽量地泼冷水.

sentences.en: Many parents find it hard to discourage bad behaviour.
sentences.cn: 很多父母觉得要孩子循规蹈矩是件很难的事情。

sentences.en: People do not discourage this kind of petty work.
sentences.cn: 人们对这种次要的工作不加以阻止.

sentences.en: The Swiss wanted to discourage an inflow of foreign money.
sentences.cn: 瑞士人想要阻止外资流入。

sentences.en: We discourage smoking in this school.
sentences.cn: 在这所学校里我们劝阻吸烟.

sentences.en: We tried to discourage him from climbing the mountain without a guide.
sentences.cn: 我们设法劝他无向导不要去爬山.

sentences.en: You should not let one failure discourage you.
sentences.cn: 你不该失败一次就灰心丧气。

words.tran_cn: 使人沮丧的；令人气馁的
使人气馁地，使人沮丧地；阻止地
劝阻（discourage的过去分词）；使失去勇气

trans.tran_en: If someone or something discourages you, they cause you to lose your enthusiasm about your actions
to make someone less confident or less willing to do something
